tasks.title: Task Master MVP  Data Model + APIs
tasks.description: Agent, AgentMessage, Document models + endpoints + seed data.

tasks.title: Add Agent model + CRUD endpoints
tasks.description: DB model + /api/agents list/create/update.

tasks.title: Add AgentMessage model + chat endpoints
tasks.description: /api/agents/:id/messages list/post.

tasks.title: Add Document model + CRUD endpoints
tasks.description: /api/documents list/create/update.

tasks.title: Seed agents + docs
tasks.description: Seed 35 agents + sample documents.

tasks.title: Task Master MVP  UI Layout
tasks.description: Mission Control right panel + agents, chat, activity feed, docs.

tasks.title: Add right panel shell
tasks.description: 3rd column layout in app.

tasks.title: Agents panel + status cards
tasks.description: List agents + status + current task.

tasks.title: Agent chat UI (manual MVP)
tasks.description: Thread + send message form.

tasks.title: Activity feed panel
tasks.description: Recent activity list.

tasks.title: Documents panel
tasks.description: List + preview docs.

tasks.title: Task Master MVP  Assignment Automation
tasks.description: Auto-process when assigned to agent (MVP behavior).

tasks.title: Auto-move to Inprogress on agent assignment
tasks.description: When assignee matches agent, move task to Inprogress.

tasks.title: Set agent status active + log activity
tasks.description: Update agent.status and activity feed.

tasks.title: Add system comment on auto-start
tasks.description: Comment: Agent started work.

tasks.title: Task Master MVP  QA + Polish
tasks.description: Validate flows and fix layout/UX issues.

tasks.title: Validate activity feed logging
tasks.description: Ensure all actions logged.

tasks.title: Verify agent assignment UX
tasks.description: Assignee list includes agents.

tasks.title: Fix layout/responsive issues
tasks.description: Tighten spacing, overflow, etc.

tasks.title: Migrate DB to MongoDB
tasks.description: Move from SQLite/Prisma to MongoDB with migration scripts and API updates.

tasks.title: Planning + schema design
tasks.description: Map Prisma schema to Mongo collections, indexing, relation strategy.

tasks.title: Set up MongoDB + Prisma config
tasks.description: Add Mongo connection, update datasource, generate client.

tasks.title: Data migration scripts
tasks.description: Export SQLite data, import into Mongo, validate counts.

tasks.title: API compatibility updates
tasks.description: Adjust queries/mutations for Mongo/Prisma differences.

tasks.title: QA + rollout plan
tasks.description: Regression tests, backup/rollback, cutover steps.

tasks.title: Activity Drawer
tasks.description: right hand should have activity drawer that looks like filter drawer default closed but when opens it should push the board

comments.author: clawd
comments.body: Disabled epic delete when stories exist (button disabled with tooltip) in App.jsx.

comments.author: clawd
comments.body: Moved epic filters into left filter panel (Search/Status/Assigned) and removed top-row filters in epics view.

comments.author: clawd
comments.body: Updated epics board columns to mirror project enabled columns (fallback Inprogress/Done) in App.jsx.

comments.author: clawd
comments.body: Added drag-and-drop support to epics board columns in App.jsx (cards draggable, column drop moves epic).

comments.author: clawd
comments.body: Confirmed: epic flow now defaults assignee to epic assignee (New Story from epic).

comments.author: assistant
comments.body: Fixed epic detail edit panel to refresh selected task data after updates; invalidates task query and refetches so assignee/priority/etc changes reflect immediately.

comments.author: assistant
comments.body: Added a + Story shortcut on epic cards that opens the task modal prefilled with the epic, project, and assignee.

comments.author: assistant
comments.body: Epic status selects in create/edit now use the board columns (no longer limited to Inprogress/Done or forced Backlog).

comments.author: assistant
comments.body: Forced epic detail edit fields to stay left-aligned by setting LTR direction/text-align on details inputs/textarea styles.

comments.author: assistant
comments.body: Epic cards now show status/type breakdowns as visual badges (colored chips) instead of plain text lines.

comments.author: assistant
comments.body: Made epic cards collapsible on the epic board with per-epic collapse/expand toggles that preserve minimal info when collapsed.

comments.author: clawd
comments.body: Reordered nav: Board/Epics in top section; Users/Profile/Logout moved to bottom section (App.jsx).

comments.author: clawd
comments.body: Enabled auto-refresh for board every 10s (refetchInterval) without closing modals in App.jsx.

comments.author: assistant
comments.body: New story on epic is available via the New Story action in epic details and the + Story shortcut on epic cards in the Epics view.

comments.author: assistant
comments.body: Expanded admin user management: inline edit of display name/role/active, multi-select project assignment, and save button with change detection.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Starting TM-43. Plan: add a quick Activate/Deactivate button in Admin Users to toggle active state via /api/admin/users/:id, keep drafts in sync, and refresh list.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Done: added a quick Activate/Deactivate button in Admin Users (apps/web/src/App.jsx) that PATCHes active state, updates local draft, and refreshes. Kept existing Save flow intact. Comment in code tagged TM-43.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Starting TM-49. Plan: show per-column counts on story board headers, using the filtered task list so counts react to filters.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Done: added per-column counts in story board headers using merged.tasksByColName so counts reflect active filters. Implemented in apps/web/src/App.jsx with TM-49 note.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Starting TM-50. Plan: add per-column counts on epic board headers, using the filtered epic list so counts reflect filters.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Done: added per-column counts in epic board headers using epicsFiltered so counts reflect filters. Implemented in apps/web/src/App.jsx with TM-50 note.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Starting TM-40. Plan: in epic edit view, render a scrollable list of sub-tickets (id, title, type, assignee) and constrain height so it does not overflow the screen.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Done: added a Sub tickets section in the epic details panel showing ID, title, type, assignee. List is scrollable with max height (~30vh) to prevent overflow. Implemented in apps/web/src/App.jsx (TM-40).

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Starting TM-42. Plan: verify create-user flow in Admin Users exists; if gaps, add UX/validation. Will comment with changes.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Reviewed TM-42: create-user flow is already implemented in Admin Users (apps/web/src/App.jsx AdminUsersPage: username/displayName/role/password -> POST /api/admin/users). No code changes needed.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Starting TM-32. Plan: ensure board/epic data auto-refreshes (polling) without closing detail panels; add background refetch on epics and keep existing board polling.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Done: added polling/background refetch for epics data (10s) so epic/board views reflect API/other-user status changes without closing detail panels. boardsQ already had polling; left intact.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Starting TM-36. Plan: when grouped by Type, tint swimlane border/header green for story and red for bug.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Done: added swimlane tinting when grouped by Type (story=green, bug=red) via swimlane border/header color. Implemented in apps/web/src/App.jsx with TM-36 note.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Starting TM-51. Plan: extend epic sub-ticket list to include status column (column name) in the epic details panel.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Done: added Status column to epic sub-ticket list using column name lookup. Implemented in TaskDetailsPanel (apps/web/src/App.jsx) with updated grid layout.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Starting TM-52. Plan: compute % done on epic cards based on story statuses (Done vs not Done) and display on epic card UI.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Done: added percent done on epic cards using Done vs total story count (stats.percentDone). Updated epicStatsFor to compute doneCount/percentDone and render in collapsed+expanded epic cards.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Starting TM-53. Plan: fix TaskDetailsPanel crash by passing columnsByProject into the component and defaulting to empty map.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Done: fixed crash by passing columnsByProject into TaskDetailsPanel and defaulting to an empty map; updated status lookup to use the prop. (apps/web/src/App.jsx)

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Starting TM-54. Plan: remove story count from epic card and render percent done as a colored pill (red 0-40, blue 41-74, green 75+).

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Done: removed story count from epic cards and rendered percent-done as a colored pill (red 0-40, blue 41-74, green 75+) in both collapsed and expanded epic cards. (apps/web/src/App.jsx)

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Starting TM-35. Plan: add collapsible swimlanes for grouped views with per-group toggle state.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Done: added collapsible swimlanes for grouped views with per-column/group toggle state and count indicator. Implemented in App.jsx (TM-35).

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Starting TM-33. Plan: poll activity feed, show bubble notifications for task moves by other users/API, suppress for current user.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Done: added activity-feed polling and bubble notifications for task.move events by other users/API. Suppressed self-actions; notifications auto-dismiss. (apps/web/src/App.jsx)

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Starting TM-34. Plan: align epic board header/title with story board and keep styling consistent.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Done: updated epic board header title to "Epic Board" to match story board naming while keeping existing board layout/functionality. (apps/web/src/App.jsx)

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Starting TM-41. Plan: verify user list UI exists in Admin Users page; add/adjust if missing.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Reviewed TM-41: Admin Users page already provides a full user list UI (list, edit fields, active toggle, project assignment, reset actions) in apps/web/src/App.jsx. No changes needed.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Starting TM-44. Plan: verify admin-only role change UI/API exists; adjust if needed.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Reviewed TM-44: Admin Users page already allows role changes and is protected by admin-only API routes. Role selector + Save PATCH /api/admin/users/:id (admin guarded). No changes needed.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Starting TM-45. Plan: verify API key reset/generate exists (admin + profile) and document if already implemented.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Reviewed TM-45: API key reset/generate is already implemented. Admin Users has Reset API Key (POST /api/admin/users/:id/api-key) and Profile has Rotate Key (POST /api/me/api-key). No changes needed.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Starting TM-46. Plan: verify one-click API key copy exists in profile/admin; add if missing.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Reviewed TM-46: one-click API key copy already exists on Profile page (Copy button uses clipboard). Admin side exposes new key via alert. No changes needed.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Starting TM-47. Plan: verify user-to-project assignment UI/API exists; add if missing.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Reviewed TM-47: Admin Users page already supports assigning projects via multi-select and POST /api/admin/users/:id/projects. No changes needed.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Starting TM-48. Plan: add search + role/status filters to Admin Users list UI.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Done: added Admin Users search + role/status filters. Implemented userSearch/roleFilter/statusFilter with filteredUsers and UI controls in apps/web/src/App.jsx.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Starting TM-55. Plan: tint swimlane borders/headers when grouped by priority (high=red, medium=orange, low=yellow).

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Done: added priority swimlane tinting (high=red, medium=orange, low=yellow) when grouped by priority. Implemented in App.jsx (TM-55).

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Starting TM-56. Plan: move Admin Users search/filters into a left filter panel styled like the story board filters.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Done: moved Admin Users search/role/status filters into a left filter panel using the same filter panel styling (FilterSection). Removed inline filter row above the list and wrapped Admin Users page in a two-column layout. (apps/web/src/App.jsx)

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Starting TM-57. Plan: add + New User button in Admin Users header and move Create User form into a modal.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Done: added + New User button in Admin Users header and moved Create User form into a modal. Create still posts to /api/admin/users and closes on success. (apps/web/src/App.jsx)

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Starting TM-58. Plan: refactor Admin Users list into a table, add row-level edit modal and active/inactive toggle from table.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Done: replaced Admin Users list with a table (user info + actions), added row-level Edit modal with project assignments + active toggle, and kept quick Activate/Deactivate from table. (apps/web/src/App.jsx)

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Starting TM-59. Plan: add project filter to Admin Users left filter panel and apply it to filteredUsers.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Done: added project filter to Admin Users left filter panel and applied it in filteredUsers. (apps/web/src/App.jsx)

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Starting TM-60. Plan: add API key reset and password reset actions in user table, with popup showing new value and one-click copy.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Done: added Reset API Key + Reset Password actions in user table; resets open a modal showing the new value with one-click copy. Passwords are generated automatically. (apps/web/src/App.jsx)

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Starting TM-61. Plan: verify Create Project flow exists (Project list + modal create) and note gaps if any.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Reviewed TM-61: Create Project flow already exists on Projects screen (+ New Project opens modal and POST /api/projects). No changes needed.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Starting TM-62. Plan: verify Edit Project flow exists (project settings modal + PATCH /api/projects/:id).

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Reviewed TM-62: Edit Project flow already exists via Project Settings modal (gear) and PATCH /api/projects/:id. No changes needed.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Starting TM-63. Plan: verify Delete Project flow exists; note limitations if only empty projects can be deleted.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Working TM-63: adding Delete Project action in project settings modal (with confirmation) and wiring to DELETE /api/projects/:id (guarded for empty projects).

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Done: added Delete Project action to Project Settings modal (with confirmation) and wired DELETE /api/projects/:id. On success refreshes projects and clears selection. (apps/web/src/App.jsx)

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Starting TM-64. Plan: verify Project Settings modal exists and supports editing columns/settings.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Reviewed TM-64: Project Settings modal already exists (ProjectModal) and updates settings/columns via PATCH /api/projects/:id. No changes needed.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Starting TM-65. Plan: build Project list UI similar to Admin Users table (table rows + actions) in Projects view.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Done: replaced project cards with a table-based Project list UI (code/name/actions) similar to user list; kept Open + Settings actions. (apps/web/src/App.jsx)

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Starting TM-66. Plan: add project filters (search/status?) similar to user filters, likely via left filter panel on Projects view.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Done: added Project filters (search + status) in a left filter panel for Projects view, similar to user filters. (apps/web/src/App.jsx)

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Starting TM-67. Plan: disable Project Delete in settings when project has tasks, using a task count fetched from the board.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Done: Project Settings modal now fetches task count and disables Delete when tasks exist, with hint message. (apps/web/src/App.jsx)

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Starting TM-68. Plan: add toggle to switch Projects view between table/cards; add stat pills on project cards (users, epics, stories, bugs, % done).

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Done: added tablecard view toggle for Projects, and project card stat pills (users, epics, stories, bugs, % done). Stats are computed per project from epics + columns, users from admin list. (apps/web/src/App.jsx)

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Starting TM-69. Plan: check project create/edit flow status (lane) selection; if missing ability to add custom statuses, assess scope and propose update.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: TM-69 note: current create/edit only toggles default lanes (Backlog/Todo/Inprogress/Done). Backend create uses DEFAULT_COLUMNS and does not support adding custom statuses yet. Need confirmation to extend API/DB + UI to create custom columns.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Per instruction, not extending to custom statuses. Current behavior remains default lanes only; closing TM-69 without changes.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Done: Project create/edit now accepts CSV statuses. UI uses comma-separated lane input; API creates missing columns, orders them, enables provided list, disables others. (apps/web/src/App.jsx, apps/api/src/index.js)

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Starting TM-70. Plan: ensure story board columns and status options are driven by project settings (dynamic columns).

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Reviewed TM-70: story board already uses project-defined columns (enabled columns from project settings). Task status dropdowns (story/bug) also pull from project columns. No changes needed.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Fix: board columns now react to project status changes by updating selectedStatusNames when merged.colNames changes, ensuring new columns appear. (apps/web/src/App.jsx)

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Starting TM-71. Plan: ensure epic board columns follow project settings (dynamic columns) and update when statuses change.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Done: epic board columns now always use project settings (even when no board loaded) by sourcing columns from projectsQ as fallback. Epic status mapping uses these columns. (apps/web/src/App.jsx)

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Starting TM-72. Plan: hide empty columns on story board (do not render columns with zero tasks).

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Done: added "No stories" placeholder for empty story-board columns to match epic board behavior. (apps/web/src/App.jsx)

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Starting TM-73. Plan: align epic board/card styling with story board/card (layout, spacing, typography).

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Done: epic board cards now use story-card styling via .epicCard class (background, border, padding, typography). (apps/web/src/App.jsx, App.css)

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Starting TM-74. Plan: audit code for hardcoded usernames/passwords, replace with logged-in user context, and update README with deployment/setup steps.

comments.author: clawdbot
comments.body: Done: removed hardcoded usernames/passwords in UI defaults (login fields, comment author/createdBy fallbacks), and updated README with deployment steps + seed note. (apps/web/src/App.jsx, README.md)

comments.author: clawd
comments.body:
TM-96 Planning + schema design results

Mongo collection mapping (Prisma Mongo):
- users: User
- projects: Project (+ columns embedded or separate collection)
- columns: Column (if separate)
- tasks: Task
- comments: Comment
- activities: Activity
- agents: Agent
- documents: Document
- agentMessages: AgentMessage
- userProjects: UserProjects

Relation strategy:
- Use references (ObjectId) for Task->Project/Column/Epic, Comment->Task, Activity->Task/Project, Agent->currentTask, Document->Task, AgentMessage->Agent, UserProjects->User/Project.
- Avoid embedding large arrays (tasks/comments) to keep updates simple.
- Consider embedding Project.columns if we want faster board load (then Column model can be removed).

Indexes to add:
- Task: projectId, columnId, epicId, ticketNumber (unique per project)
- Comment: taskId
- Activity: projectId, taskId, at
- AgentMessage: agentId
- UserProjects: userId+projectId unique

Migration approach:
- One-time export from SQLite (JSON) and import to Mongo (ordered: users  projects  columns  tasks  comments  activities  agents  docs  agentMessages  userProjects).
- Validate counts + spot-check task/epic relations.

Risks/notes:
- Prisma Mongo doesnt support some relational constraints; enforce in app.
- ticketNumber uniqueness must be enforced in code or via compound unique index.
- Date handling stays ISO in JSON.

Next: TM-97 set up Mongo Prisma datasource + update schema.

comments.author: clawd
comments.body:
TM-96 Planning + schema design results

Mongo collection mapping (Prisma Mongo):
- users: User
- projects: Project (+ columns embedded or separate collection)
- columns: Column (if separate)
- tasks: Task
- comments: Comment
- activities: Activity
- agents: Agent
- documents: Document
- agentMessages: AgentMessage
- userProjects: UserProjects

Relation strategy:
- Use references (ObjectId) for Task->Project/Column/Epic, Comment->Task, Activity->Task/Project, Agent->currentTask, Document->Task, AgentMessage->Agent, UserProjects->User/Project.
- Avoid embedding large arrays (tasks/comments) to keep updates simple.
- Consider embedding Project.columns if we want faster board load (then Column model can be removed).

Indexes to add:
- Task: projectId, columnId, epicId, ticketNumber (unique per project)
- Comment: taskId
- Activity: projectId, taskId, at
- AgentMessage: agentId
- UserProjects: userId+projectId unique

Migration approach:
- One-time export from SQLite (JSON) and import to Mongo (ordered: users  projects  columns  tasks  comments  activities  agents  docs  agentMessages  userProjects).
- Validate counts + spot-check task/epic relations.

Risks/notes:
- Prisma Mongo doesnt support some relational constraints; enforce in app.
- ticketNumber uniqueness must be enforced in code or via compound unique index.
- Date handling stays ISO in JSON.

Next: TM-97 set up Mongo Prisma datasource + update schema.

comments.author: clawd
comments.body:
TM-97 Set up MongoDB + Prisma config  progress

 Updated Prisma schema with proper inverse relations so migrations work:
- Task.currentAgents  Agent.currentTask (relation name AgentCurrentTask)
- Task.documents  Document.task (relation name TaskDocuments)
- Agent.messages  AgentMessage.agent (relation name AgentMessages)

 Ran migration: npx prisma migrate dev --name mission-control
- DB now synced with new models (Agent/Document/AgentMessage + relations).

Mongo setup plan (ready to implement):
1) Switch datasource in prisma/schema.prisma to provider = "mongodb".
2) Add DATABASE_URL for Mongo (mongodb+srv://...).
3) Update schema id fields to @db.ObjectId where required (Mongo Prisma needs ObjectId).
4) Run: npx prisma db push (Mongo) instead of migrate.
5) Re-generate Prisma client and update any query differences.

Note: kept SQLite provider for now to avoid breaking running system; changeover should happen alongside TM-98 migration scripts.

comments.author: clawd
comments.body:
TM-98 Data migration scripts delivered

Scripts added:
1) scripts/mongo_export_sqlite.js
   - Exports all tables from SQLite via Prisma to JSON.
   - Output: /data/migration/sqlite-export-<timestamp>.json

2) scripts/mongo_import_mongo.js
   - Imports JSON into Mongo using Prisma createMany.
   - Usage: node scripts/mongo_import_mongo.js <export.json>

Notes:
- Run export before switching datasource.
- For Mongo, set provider = "mongodb" and DATABASE_URL then run "npx prisma db push" (not migrate).
- Validate counts after import (users, projects, tasks, comments, activities, agents, docs).

comments.author: clawd
comments.body:
TM-99 API compatibility updates (Mongo)  checklist

Likely code updates when switching to Mongo: 
- Prisma Mongo uses ObjectId for id fields; ensure client accepts string ids (already).
- Replace any reliance on SQL features not supported by Mongo.
- Avoid nested transactions; Mongo connector has limits.
- Review aggregate usage: max/min/order still supported.
- Ensure unique constraints: ticketNumber unique per project must be enforced in code or compound unique index in Prisma schema.
- Review relations: include() still works with relations, but ensure relation fields are correct in schema for Mongo (ObjectId types).

API endpoints to validate:
- /api/projects (include columns)
- /api/projects/:id/board (column/task joins)
- /api/projects/:id/epics (stories lookup by epicId)
- /api/tasks create/move/update/delete
- /api/activity feed
- /api/agents + /api/documents + /api/agents/:id/messages

Plan:
1) Switch datasource to Mongo + db push.
2) Run migration import script (TM-98).
3) Run smoke tests for endpoints above.
4) Fix any query differences found.
